content.description: Following a bolt line that moves up some blocky terrain below a steeper face at the right end of the Deja Vu area.
content.location: The far right bolt line at Deja Vu. If you are standing directly below the chimney looking to the right at blocky terrain detached from a steep face that also happens to be below a bolt line then you've gone to high and too far left.

content.description: Start directly below the large chimney. Instead of continuing up the dirty chimney trend right onto the face following the bolts.
content.location: Fourth bolt line from the left and second from the right at Deja Vu. It's also located a bit to the left of some blocky below the face at the right end of the area.

content.description: Climb up directly below a dark, chimney feature. The route begins downhill and to the right of routes A-D. Climb directly upwards into the chimney. Continue up the chimney for 5.7 climbing or step left (out of the chimney) into the crack system on the face for some 5.8 climbing. Easy to protect and not sustained.
content.protection: Easily protected with a single rack to a couple of inches. Bolted anchors.
content.location: Start directly below the largest chimney-like feature at Deja Vu.

content.description: Follow the bolts and things should be straight forward. It is harder if you climb it in running shoes.
content.location: Start at the blocky bits three routes in from the bolt line at the far left of the Deja Vu area. Instead of moving into the left-facing corner follow the bolt just to the right.

content.description: Climb the bolt line (second from the left) up the slab and face. The upper part of the route follows a shallow, flaring crack finger crack a few feet left of the obvious flake
content.location: On the face near the end of the Deja Vu area. See description.

content.description: Climb up the blocks to the left facing corner and follow the obvious flake up to the bolted anchor. The most difficult moves are well-protected and there are a couple of hands-free rest opportunities. This route would be no harder than 5.8 at other areas in Leavenworth or at Index.
content.protection: Small trad rack with small pieces.
content.location: Third route from the left at Deja Vu. See description.

content.description: A is the name of the left-most climb in the Deja Vu area. Bolted climbing leads a bolted anchor. The second half of the climb can be approached one of two ways. Left of the small overhang in the white patch leads to 5.10+ climbing where as staying right is rated 5.11.
content.location: It is the second bolt line uphill from the small chimney that leads to the left facing corner.
